input2:
He is with chronic pancreatitis, seen by Dr. C who returns to the ED with 3 days of progressive nonradiating burning epigastric abdominal pain that is worsened with eating and alleviated with Dilaudid. He also reports, nausea and some nonbloody vomiting, but denies fevers, chills, SOB, pleuritic pain, abdominal swelling, leg swelling, diarrhea, dysuria, hematuria. He reports that he's decreased his oral intake over the past few days, but denies NSAID use, recent viral infection, EtOH use. He does smoke 1 ppd for the past yrs. He reports that these symptoms are typical of a pancreatitis flare.  

Of note, recent normal EUS in.  

In the ED he was treated with Zofran, Morphine 4 mg IV x 2, and NS.States BP at ED 167/92.
input3:
+Psoriasis  
+Chronic Abdominal Pain  
+Type 2 DM  
+GERD  
+Hyperlipidemia  
+Vascular necrosis of the hip  
+Atrial tachycardia
input5:
Vitals - T:97.5 BP: 176/82 HR: 96 RR:18 02 sat: 97 RA  
GENERAL: wincing, writing in bed, communicative  
SKIN: diaphoretic, no lesions or rashes  
HEENT: AT/NC, EOMI, PERRLA, anicteric sclera, pink conjunctiva, patent nares, MMM, good dentition, nontender supple neck, no LAD, no JVD  
CARDIAC: tachycardic, S1/S2, no mrg  
LUNG: good airmovement, slight expiratory wheezes in lower lung fields bilaterally  
ABDOMEN: nondistended, +BS, tenderness to palpation in epigastrium, no rebound/guarding, no hepatosplenomegaly  
M/S: moving all extremities well, no cyanosis, clubbing or edema, no obvious deformities  
PULSES: 2+ DP pulses bilaterally  
NEURO: CN II-XII intact

MRCP with secretin 
IMPRESSION: 
1. Mild side branch dilatation in the pancreatic body and tail after secretin administration, consistent with mild chronic pancreatitis. 
2. Three tiny pancreatic cystic lesions, which may be sequela of prior pancreatitis or tiny side branch IPMNs. Followup MRI in six months could be performed to document stability. 

CXR
IMPRESSION: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality.
